intro: Hemiboeopsis, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions with arid or semi-arid climates. The plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their woody stems and compound leaves. Hemiboeopsis species are known for their hard, durable wood, which has been used traditionally for construction and tool-making. They also play a role in stabilizing soils in their native habitats.
